headline: Strawberry Vanilla Pancakes
description: These strawberry pancakes are packed with fresh fruit and flavor. The vanilla makes this breakfast seem like dessert — everyone will ask for more!
name: Strawberry Vanilla Pancakes

recipeInstructions.text: Stir flour, brown sugar, baking powder, and salt together in a medium bowl. Pour in milk, egg, oil, and vanilla; mix until well blended. Stir in strawberries.
Grease and heat a large skillet or griddle over medium heat.

Drop batter by large spoonfuls onto the griddle and cook until bubbles form and the edges are dry, 2 to 3 minutes. Flip and cook until browned on the other side, about 2 minutes more. Repeat with remaining batter.

review.reviewBody: These pancakes do taste delicious, I felt like several changes were needed though. For dietary reasons I used half oat flour, I cut down the sugar to 1 Tbsp - sugar in pancakes is mostly for color so you don't need much, I used about 3/4 cup milk in part because I was using frozen strawberries, and didn't want to add too much liquid. I defrosted 1 cup of strawberries, and mashed them. I also cut the vanilla down to 2 tsp, and it still tasted distinctly of vanilla. The batter was still pretty thin - on the thinner side of normal pancake batter, but as promised, they puffed up nicely when cooked, after letting the batter sit for a few minutes.

I made no changes, way too much salt and baking powder. I could taste it, really didn't care for the brown sugar flavor, thin batter that didn't rise even with so much baking powder. I would never make these again,
Made these this morning for my husband. They were absolutely fabulous. I added extra strawberries just because and the batch made about 10 pancakes. Loved them!
Made it. Very simple to make and not too sugary. I actually added a bit of sugar.
I made the recipe without any alterations. They were great! I didn't dice my strawberries small enough, but other than that they were very good.
Batter was very thin and I would use less strawberries. Taste was fine. Will try again with some changes

The only fault I have with this recipe is that the pancakes tasted VERY salty. I doubled the recipe and made it as written except I did cut back the milk by about a 1/4 cup. They were nice and fluffy and had a great vanilla flavor. Next time I’ll just cut the salt by half
The batter was extremely thin. I had to keep adding more and more flour. Despite the hassle of having to add extra flour , the flavor was good .
I really love this recipe! I only use 1 Tbls of vanilla and do everything else as listed. A nice fluffy pancake for the weekend!
I would use a little less strawberry next time. But other than that it was delicious!!!
They were good. I would have preferred a fluffier pancake. I also think I could taste the baking powder but no one else said so, maybe it was just me
Light and tasty

I used blueberries instead of strawberry s . They turn out really good . My son-in-law , daughter & grandkids enjoy them a lot . This year I'm thinking about using pineapple & cherries in them . My daughter B-Day is on the 4 th of July . That will be a special B-Day breakfast for her this year .
I used coconut oil and heavy whipping cream instead of milk and vegetable oil. I also topped them with cream cheese. These pancakes are really good, though I strongly recommend using coconut oil!
The only change we made was to half the vanilla. Yummy.
I doubled recipe, cake out fluffy and amazing! My boys gobbled them up.
I used only half the amount of salt, brown sugar and vanilla extract. Turned out great and it wasn’t runny at all!
Easy recipe! Delicious! I was just looking for something to do with my strawberries before they went bad but this is also a recipe my teenager can make as well.

Family & friends love them. I also slice 3-4c. strawberries in a separate container the night before with 1/2c. sugar & 1c. Pure Maple Syrup. Stir together until sugar is dissolved to make a strawberry maple syrup. Just heat it to room temp the next morning. Pour over Strawberry Pancakes...YUM ??
I don't even like pancakes... But man do I LOVE these!!!!
I loved the taste and I don't think that I would change it again!

5 stars cause they are good! I followed the recipe to the T and was sceptical because it was very thin. About half way through the batter I added a little more flour and ended up burning most of the rest. A commenter said to let the batter rest (I didn't know this) so I will do that next time. I will also spread out the middle so the middle will cook better. Thanks so much for sharing this recipe. It's really good! Never had brown sugar in pancakes before.
not the best recipe. pancake batter was very runny. pancakes were not fluffy at all and did not taste all that great.
My kids loved it ! I shall surely make it again!
Not my favorite...
I followed the recipe exactly and ended up with runny batter

I used evaporated milk instead of whole milk and only used 1 tbsp of vanilla as others suggested that 2 would be overkill. These turned out great. I added the strawberries to the mix at the end so they weren't too soggy when I ate the pancakes. I thought the recipe wouldn't make very many, but it made 5 average- to large-sized pancakes, which was perfect for me and my husband (no need for leftovers). Definitely saving this recipe.
I love this recipe and i will make again and again till it starts to never get old.
My family loved these pancakes! Just be sure to dice the strawberries to make the pancakes easier to cook!

I made this Strawberry Pancake for my sister birthday and SHE LOVED IT. So does my mom, haha. It was perfect, while I was cooking it the smell was super delicious. 
I give this recipe 5 stars. 
I didn't change a thing, I just shift the flower twice. I set the batter aside for like 15 mins before I start pouring it in the hot pan. The only thing I did was I sweeten the strawberries with 1/2 cup sugar to bring out it's natural juice. Then I add that juice to my pancake batter, because of that the flavor was little stronger which my sister liked it a lot. 
Over all very successful recipe, loved it, can't wait to make is again.
I make these constantly they are so yummy!
I had a hard time with the pancakes sticking but after tasting them it was well worth the trouble,wonderfel!!!

I did not make any changes. The batter was more like crepe batter than pancake batter. It had a nice flavor but was difficult to flip. I made this recipe because my 7 yr old grandson saw the picture on my phone and he nagged me until I made them. Then he didn't like them. I may try them again but cook them in my crepe pan. Next time I will try the "fluffy pancake recipe".

I made it first by placing the strawberries after I poured some on the griddle, and the second time by folding the strawberries into the mixture. Folding them in was definitely better. If was a fluffy recipe! It was salty tasting to me. It was just okay.
I did not care for this recipe.

Really good, I made it with the Splenda brown sugar blend and instead of 2 tablespoons of vanilla I only used 2 teaspoons. It was still fantastic, my daughter was so thrilled, she kept wanting more. Great recipe. I might have to try it without the oil too.
I wish the recipe gave guidelines for how long it takes to brown on both sides. For me, one side ended up burnt, and the other side ended up undercooked.
Love it! We eat our pancakes vegan so I just used almond milk and flax egg, but came out perfect and delicious!

These were so moist and fluffy-- really beautiful texture. You couldn't ask for more moist pancakes! I upped the brown sugar to 3T and dropped the vanilla a bit to 1.5T, and sifted the flour. I didn't find the batter to be extremely runny, like some other reviewers, but letting it sit for a few minutes before adding to the pan is crucial. Also, I chopped up the strawberries and let them sit on a paper towel, to let any excess liquid soak off, until I was just about ready to use the batter, and then mixed them in. Try these-- you won't regret it! Thanks for a great pancake recipe! =)
Tasted delicious! I changed the measurement of the vanilla from tablespoons to teaspoons though because it seemed like too much vanilla.
Yum. Used 3/4 cup milk. Will make again.
It was a bit too runny of a mix. They tasted alright but they weren't fluffy. :(
Made it exactly as recipe stated. They were wonderful. I topped with extra chopped strawberries, whipped cream and maple syrup. Delicious!!!!!
Good flavor. But would probably omit the oil as others have said. Had the same slightly runny problem. Also, decrease vanilla to teaspoons.

After eating in complete silance, I asked the boys (husband and 12 yr old son), "Well, how did you like the pancakes?" - hubby said, "I thought they were really really good, possibly the best pancakes you ever made" My son said "oh, yeah, these were the best". I made mostly as written, 2TBSP vanilla was no problem, yes it was rather thin, but as most said, it fluffed right up. My only hiccup - when it was time to put in the vegetable oil, oops, I don't have any, no canola either.....ummmmm...ok, well I added one TBSP of melted butter (didn't want to do two, just in case it really screwed up the recipe)....no problem, tasted great as stated earlier.
These were amazing! We liked them best with the strawberries on top instead of inside. The batter is runny like crepe batter, but fluff up like pancakes.

I made these following the recipe exactly and they deserve 5 stars. After that, I adjusted the recipe to our taste -- half white flour and half whole wheat, and plain yogurt instead of milk and they came out great. They have the texture of recipes where the eggs are separated and the whites whipped.

The pancakes came out light and fluffy despite of how runny the mix was, which doesn't bother me anyway. However, I sort of made up my own recipe by making these alterations. I cut the cup of all purpose flour in half and added 1/2 cup if whole wheat flour. I also used almond extract instead of vanilla. My taste buds prefer the almond extract with strawberries over the vanilla. Waaaaay too much salt. I put in the teaspoon of salt but it was overpowering, so the next time I make these, I will cut it down by half.
The pancakes were fluffy and soft! My family loved them! I added a little more flour for being a little too watery but even then is was quite delicious! Keeping it as favorite!
We eat this all the time. Best combination is to put whipped cream infused with cardamom on top. Possibly the greatest breakfast we need to have at least once a month now.
These were really good - loved the strong vanilla flavor. The batter was a little bit thin, but overall a good recipe.
Really good! We had some half-and-half to use up, so that replaced the milk and only used 1T vanilla (which was plenty). Very nice, fluffy texture.

I tried this recipe out, and it was great. This is a great way to use your fresh strawberries! It was nice a fluffy, and it was gooey and nice juicy on the inside filled with strawberries. I had to add a little more flour because the batter was a little runny, but once it got thickened up, it was great and easy to make. You can also make changes to this recipe and instead of adding strawberries, you can add a different fruit, like blueberries. I even tried it plain! It tasted like a nice sweet vanilla pancake. I definitely hope you try this recipe out, because it's a really great one!

Impressive. I did reduce the salt and Vanilla by 1/2 but other than that left everything else alone. Tasted great. Yes the batter is runny, but so what, they cook up fine and the end result is a full pancake. In fact I'm now thinking the thin batter is what keeps them light and fluffy.

It's a good recipe overall. I've made it twice. Once with puréed strawberries & quick cooking oats and another with puréed mangos. Both times were delicious & toddler approved. My two mischievous monkeys enjoyed cooking with mommy. We make a bunch & freeze for later in the week for those crazy rushed mornings.
they tasted really good but the batter was so liquidy
My family loved these pancakes. I used vanilla almond milk in place of regular milk and that added even more vanilla flavor. I only used a 1/4 tsp of salt. They were very fluffy and very flavorful.

About 1.5 tbsps vanilla
Needs less salt

These are good. I will likely try them again the next time
my wife wants strawberry pancakes
I made these today and followed the recipe exactly as written, I was thinking that there may be too much vanilla, but they were DELICIOUS!!! Will definitely be making them again :)
Delicious!! I used white whole wheat flour and replaced milk and vanilla extract with vanilla almond milk. Healthy and yummy!
The salt needs to be cut by at least half, but other than that, they tasted great
I thought they were ok but not delicious.
I made these following the directions and they were not as light and fluffy as stated.
Love the combination! The only difference I made was I used whole wheat flour because that is all I had. I had no issues at all! Thank you for posting!

One reviewer said the egg is not included in the direction-but it is. I agree with that reviewer that the batter was VERY watery; however, since these are called Vanilla pancakes, using less vanilla extract really doesn't seem to be the logical answer. Adding more flour, however, does. I added a whole cup of flour, making it 2 cups total. I also opted to use cake flour, something I picked up from a different pancake recipe. Do not over whisk pancakes. That is kind of the first cardinal rule. It is difficult to know if you over whisked, but if batter is slightly lumpy, you probably didn't. If upon flipping the pancakes, the rise slightly, you will know they are light and fluffy! I thought the recipe overall was great! One of the tastier recipes I have found, with minimal tweeks.
Use egg whites when making pancakes. It helps make them fluffier and goats milk gives that extra yummy taste. These turned out amazing with just those two changes!
The pancakes were good. Didnt like the strawberries in pancake. Substituted milke and used buttermilk, 1/2 teaspoon salt. Will make again without strawberries.
Followed recipe to the t.didn't taste vanilla at all. They were OK. My grandson who loves all things strawberry ate 3 pancakes. He usually eats one.batter is thin but they cook up nice

This was wonderful! And so easy to make. Only substitution I made was to use real maple syrup for the sugar. Used whole milk and mostly organic
Ingredients. Next time I'm going to try it with almond flour and almond milk but the original is definitely wonderful. 2 T of vanilla sounded like a lot but turned out to be just perfect. I also made a topping by cooking down sliced strawberries, a touch of maple syrup and a tiny bit of water. Thanks so much for sharing!
substituted coconut oil for vegetable oil and eyeballed milk to get the consistency I wanted. They were delicious!
Big hit with the whole family. Only changes: used 3/4 cup milk and half AP and half white whole wheat flour. My batter rested for 15 minutes before cooking.
Really great, fluffy & tasty!! I think you can easily do 1 T of oil and be fine.

I would have given this recipe a 5 except the cakes were too thin for my liking. Taste was delicious though. I substituted 1 TBLSPN of brown sugar Splenda for the 2 TBLSPN of regular Brown Sugar and 2 TBLSPN of applesauce for the oil. My kids devoured them.

Very good! Just made them for the kids and I; they were a hit. Batter was a bit watery so I did add at least 1/4c extra flour. They had the consistency of crepes, but I still served as pancakes. Recommended!
PO, Vermont
They're good. I found them easy to make and my family loved them.
Cut salt back to 1/4 teaspoon.
delious!
Mmmmm... I used whole grain white flour, added one more T sugar and only did 1/2 t salt per previous reviews. The batter did seem thin, but they fluffed up so nicely!
I've made these for years with just the box mix. Has always been a favorite in my house. Also optional is adding a tsp of cinnamon or get really crazy and add a pinch of lavender.
It great I tried it with my 15 year old son who is learning how to cook & we both enjoyed it

A bit too salty for me... I had to increase the amount of sugar by another tablespoon. I also used whole wheat flour so the batter wasn't runny as others had problems with. I ate it with honey and it was just alright for a quick treat in the morning.

Good. The batter was a bit thin, but isn't a big deal if you make the pancakes a bit smaller than usual. The 2 TBS of vanilla was excessive to me not because it was too much vanilla flavor but because you end up tasting the alcohol of the extract since it's so heavy. I'd cut back on that a bit next time, but otherwise fine as is. They'd also be fine with 1/2 all-purpose flour and 1/2 whole wheat.
Good but next time I may sprinkle some sugar on the strawberries and let set for several minutes.
These pancakes are very good. The kids ask for them all of the time. I follow the recipe exactly.
The recipe is delicious! I prefer my pancakes thick and fluffy, so I added a little more flour to the batter. They have a great flavor and make your entire kitchen smell like fresh strawberries.

I used self rising flour instead of the ap flour and baking powder and it turned out fabulously. I followed the directions otherwise and although the batter was runny I let it sit for a couple minutes before cooking it. That did thicken it up some but I don't like super thick batter anyway so this was perfect for me. I will definitely be making these again!

Too salty! Salt is not a flavor, it is a flavor enhancer and helps baked goods rise. I questioned the amount of salt but thought maybe it was to help the pancakes rise. Nope...thin, flat, salty pancakes were what we got. Won't be using this recipe again. I'll try adding vanilla to a pancake batter mix to get the same flavor. I don't like cooked strawberries, so we sliced them and used them as a topping.

My daughter does not like chunks of fruit in her food, so we liquified the strawberries in a blender. 

I gave it four stars because we had to tweak a lot of things-we added more sugar, had to slowly add the vanilla (2 Tablespoons seemed like too much-we added 2.5 teaspoons).

We will make this again!

These are great! Made the recipe as is, but chose to reduce salt. This is a thin batter......and due to the moisture in the strawberries, they can be slightly soggy. Made a triple batch and will freeze the remaining pancakes. Yummy!
Edit to prior review... I meant 1 1/2 cups MILK, not FLOUR! :)
My daughter ate these up, but I didn't care for them at all. Too salty-I would reduce that or eliminate it altogether. I used applesauce in place of the oil.
These had a good flavor but they fell apart. I also reduced the milk to 3/4 c and they were still runny.
Fabulous, just the way it is written. My picky two-year old and her discriminating dad both approve.
Best strawberry pancake we ever had. Melts in your mouth.. Definitely recommend making

My whole family loved these pancakes! I substituted whole wheat flour and left everything else the same. The vanilla comes through without the need for more. My boys were begging for me to make this again!

I give this 4 stars because i believe it's a good concept but some changes are necessary to make it great! I used 3/4 cp of whole wheat flour and substituted buttermilk, ommitted the oil and only used 2 TSP of vanilla. After doing that these turned out to be some of the BEST pancakes i've ever made!! They were not runny at all. I have never tried putting strawberries in pancakes but they were delicious with a little bit of maple syrup. I will be trying these again!

I liked this recipe taste wise, but I found that I needed almost two cups of flour instead of the listed one. Without the extra flour, they were runny and didn't cook well. Other than that, they were yummy :)
These were really yummy, but a bit salty. I would only use 1/2 tsp. of salt next time. My kids didn't seem to mind, though!
